summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by DOJ OIG Senior Special Agent Michael Matulewicz with a Bureau of Prisons Supervisory Correctional Systems Specialist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 4, 2021. The interview is part of the OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein and the surrounding circumstances. The witness discusses her role in Receiving and Discharge (R&D), the transfer of Epstein's cellmate Efrain Reyes, and her lack of direct knowledge about events leading to Epstein's death.

persons.name: Michael Matulewicz
persons.context: Conducts the interview as the lead investigator for the OIG inquiry into Jeffrey Epstein's death. He asks detailed questions about BOP procedures, the transfer of Efrain Reyes, and events of August 9-10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate at the center of the OIG investigation. The interview focuses on the circumstances surrounding his death by suicide in the MCC SHU on August 10, 2019, and the removal of his cellmate.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Inmate who was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate in the SHU. He was transferred out of the MCC on August 9, 2019, a key point in the investigation as Epstein was left without a cellmate.

persons.name: Andrea
persons.context: BOP staff member who handles inmate movement and court lists. The witness states Andrea is the one who creates the daily assignment rosters and handles transfers.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: Officer who was on duty in the SHU at the time of Epstein's death. The witness was asked to perform wellness checks on him in August 2019 but never made contact.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: Officer who was on duty in the SHU at the time of Epstein's death. The witness was asked to perform wellness checks on him in August 2019 but never made contact.

persons.name: I.M. Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate mentioned in the lieutenant's log as being placed on a 'dry cell' watch in R&D on August 9, 2019. The witness has no recollection of this.

persons.name: Jayvon Busey
persons.context: Inmate listed alongside Efrain Reyes on a U.S. Marshals Service transfer order for August 9, 2019.

connections.description: Reyes was Epstein's cellmate in the SHU. He was transferred out on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein alone in his cell.
Matulewicz is the OIG agent conducting the official interview of the BOP supervisor as part of the Epstein death investigation.
The witness and Andrea are both supervisors in the R&D department, working on different shifts but with the same responsibilities.
Both were officers assigned to the SHU on the night of Epstein's death. The witness was tasked with calling them for wellness checks afterwards.

events.title: Transfer of Efrain Reyes
events.description: Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, is transferred from the MCC SHU to a GEO facility based on U.S. Marshals Service orders. Documentation shows he was 'pre-removed' and listed as 'WAB' (With All Belongings), indicating he was not expected to return.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found dead in his cell in the MCC SHU, an apparent suicide by hanging. The investigation focuses on the failure to replace his cellmate and possible lapses in rounds and counts.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt
events.description: The witness states she learned after the fact that Epstein had a prior suicide attempt in July 2019, before the fatal incident in August.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Supervisor
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary, sworn interview with a BOP Supervisory Correctional Systems Specialist at the MCC regarding the Epstein investigation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
28632 Roadside Drive, Suite 285, Agoura Hills, CA 91301 (Resolute Documentation Services)
keyFacts: The witness, a BOP R&D supervisor, had no direct interaction with Jeffrey Epstein during his stay at the MCC and did not recall seeing him.

Documentation reviewed shows Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was transferred on August 9, 2019, with a 'WAB' (With All Belongings) designation, which the witness states definitively means an inmate is not coming back.
The witness states that SHU staff should have known Reyes was not returning based on the WAB designation, contradicting claims that they might have thought he was just going to court.
The witness was unaware of an inmate named I.M. Fernandez being placed on a 'dry cell' watch in R&D on August 9, 2019, as logged, and says that is not standard procedure.

The witness heard rumors about staff not conducting rounds/counts and falsifying records on August 9-10, 2019, but has no firsthand knowledge, attributing potential failures to a need for more training and staffing.
